thread.title: Dodgers Sweep Cubs In Tokyo Series
thread.title_full: Dodgers Sweep Cubs In Tokyo Series

author: Steven Barrera
title: Dodgers Sweep Cubs In Tokyo Series
text:
Game 2 of the Tokyo Series at the Tokyo Dome saw the Dodgers defeat the Cubs, completing the sweep to kick off their season.
With two wins in Japan, the Dodgers’ ambitious quest for a perfect 162-0 season is off to a strong start.
Japanese superstar Rōki Sasaki made his highly anticipated MLB debut, taking the mound for Los Angeles in a homecoming of sorts.
Sasaki’s first six pitches clocked in at 99.5, 99.5, 100, 100.5, 99.4, and 98.9 mph, showcasing his electric velocity.
He allowed just one hit and one run while striking out three but struggled with command, issuing five walks, including one that forced in a run. Landon Knack (1-0) earned the win with two scoreless innings of relief.
On offense, Kiké Hernández launched a two-run homer, Tommy Edman added a solo shot, and Shohei Ohtani contributed a fifth-inning blast that just cleared the right-center fence. After a brief review, the call stood, extending the Dodgers’ lead to 6-2.
With the Tokyo Series in the books, both teams now return to the U.S. The Dodgers head straight to Los Angeles to prepare for their home opener against the Detroit Tigers on March 27, while the Cubs will regroup in Mesa, Arizona, before beginning their season on the road against the Arizona Diamondbacks that same day.

KHTS Santa Clarita News Alertsdelivered right to your inbox. Report a typo or error, email Corrections@hometownstation.com
KHTS FM 98.1 and AM 1220 is Santa Clarita’s only local radio station. KHTS mixes in a combination of news, traffic, sports, and features along with your favorite adult contemporary hits. Santa Clarita news and features are delivered throughout the day over our airwaves, on our website and through a variety of social media platforms. Our KHTS national award-winning daily news briefs are now read daily by 34,000+ residents. A vibrant member of the Santa Clarita community, the KHTS broadcast signal reaches all of the Santa Clarita Valley and parts of the high desert communities located in the Antelope Valley. The station streams its talk shows over the web, reaching a potentially worldwide audience. Follow @KHTSRadio on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.
